# Rules
1. No bigotry - including racism, sexism, ableism, homophobia, transphobia, or xenophobia. [Code of Conduct](https://join-lemmy.org/docs/en/code_of_conduct.html).
1. Be respectful, [especially when disagreeing](https://lemmy.ml/post/1140303). Everyone should feel welcome here.
1. No porn.
1. No Ads / Spamming.


Feel free to ask questions over in:
- [!lemmy_support](https://lemmy.ml/c/lemmy_support)
- [Matrix Chat](https://matrix.to/#/#lemmy-space:matrix.org)
- [Mastodon @LemmyDev](https://mastodon.social/@LemmyDev)

site.name: Lemmy.zip
site.sidebar:
Welcome to Lemmy.zip - a community for like minded people to come and have a chat about almost anything. From games to tech, to anything else, come and have a chat.

If you're new and would like to join Lemmy.zip, please fill in the [sign up](https://lemmy.zip/signup) form. Email verification is required. (Please check your spam folder!)

Once you're signed up, come and introduce yourself in our [Home](/c/home@lemmy.zip) community! 

---

# **Useful Links**
- [m.lemmy.zip](https://m.lemmy.zip/) - Our Mobile/Tablet site
- [old.lemmy.zip](https://old.lemmy.zip/) - A familiar desktop experience!
- [a.lemmy.zip](https://a.lemmy.zip/) - A desktop-first UI
- [t.lemmy.zip](https://t.lemmy.zip/) - An alternative Mobile/Tablet UI with lots of features!
- [blorp.lemmy.zip](https://blorp.lemmy.zip/) - A new and modern Lemmy UI!
- [Join our Matrix Chat!](https://matrix.to/#/#lemmy.zip:matrix.org)

---

# **Instance Rules**

To maintain the high standard of discourse and interaction we all value, each user must adhere to the guidelines outlined in our [Code of Conduct](https://legal.lemmy.zip/posts/code_of_conduct/). This set of rules is designed not just to maintain order but also to ensure a safe and inclusive environment for everyone to share their thoughts and ideas.

**What to Expect in Our Code of Conduct:**

- **Respectful Communication**: We strive for positive, constructive dialogue and encourage all members to engage with one another in a courteous and understanding manner.
- **Inclusivity**: Embracing diversity is at the core of our community. We welcome members from all walks of life and expect interactions to be conducted without discrimination.
- **Privacy**: Your privacy is paramount. Please respect the privacy of others just as you expect yours to be treated. Personal information should never be shared without consent.
- **Integrity**: We believe in the integrity of speech and action. As such, honesty is expected, and deceptive practices are strictly prohibited.
- **Collaboration**: Whether you're here to learn, teach, or simply engage in discussion, collaboration is key. Support your fellow members and contribute positively to shared learning and growth.

If you enjoy reading legal stuff, you can check out [legal.lemmy.zip](https://legal.lemmy.zip/).

---

# **Funding**
If you would like to contribute to the upkeep of Lemmy.zip, please head over to [OpenCollective](https://opencollective.com/lemmyzip).\
Anything you're happy to donate is very highly appreciated!\
You'll even get your name in the [Thank You](https://lemmy.zip/post/130337) thread.

[![Open Collective backers](https://lemmy.zip/api/v3/image_proxy?url=https%3A%2F%2Fimg.shields.io%2Fopencollective%2Fbackers%2Flemmyzip%3Flabel%3DFinancial%2BSupporters%26amp%253Blink%3Dhttps%253A%252F%252Fopencollective.com%252Flemmyzip)](https://opencollective.com/lemmyzip)

If you want to use PayPal, you can donate via Ko-Fi:

[![](https://lemmy.zip/pictrs/image/afd02af9-f809-4bb1-a69c-c24a8e185306.webp)](https://ko-fi.com/lemmyzip)

You can also donate via Liberapay using a card or PayPal:

[![](https://lemmy.zip/api/v3/image_proxy?url=https%3A%2F%2Fimg.shields.io%2Fliberapay%2Fpatrons%2FDotZip.svg%3Flogo%3Dliberapay)](https://liberapay.com/dotzip)

We are a German and English-speaking Lemmy community that evolved from feddit\.de.

Feddit.org serves as a Reddit alternative in the Fediverse.

We see ourselves as a self-determined space, outside the control of commercial tech companies.

Netiquette is expected. A respectful interaction is maintained - without hate, harassment, discrimination.

Alternative UIs (provided by us):
- [Photon](https://p.feddit.org/)
- [Alexandrite](https://a.feddit.org/)
- [Next](https://next.feddit.org/)
- [mlmym](https://old.feddit.org/) (old)
- [Tesseract](https://t.feddit.org/)

More options like mobile apps can be found e.g. on [lemmyapps.com](https://www.lemmyapps.com/).

[Are you missing posts/comments?](https://feddit.org/post/163939)

This community is [powered by donations](https://fediverse.foundation/en/donations/) and supported by the [Fediverse Foundation](https://fediverse.foundation/).

::: spoiler Serverrules

We do not tolerate discriminatory behavior or content that promotes or advocates the oppression of members of marginalized groups. These groups may be characterized by any of the following (though this list is of course incomplete):

- ethnicity
- gender identity or expression
- sexual identity or expression
- physical characteristics or age
- disability or illness
- nationality, residency, citizenship
- wealth or education
- religious affiliation, agnosticism, or atheism

We do not tolerate threatening behavior, stalking, and doxxing. We do not tolerate harassment, including brigading, dogpiling, or any other form of contact with a user who has stated that they do not wish to be contacted.

- Be respectful. Everyone is welcome here.
- No racism, sexism, ableism, homophobia, or other xenophobia
- We do not tolerate bullying, including name-calling, intentional misgendering, or deadnaming.
 - We do not tolerate violent nationalist propaganda, Nazi symbolism or the promotion of the ideology of National Socialism. 
- Actions intended to damage this instance or its performance can lead to immediate blocking of the account.
- Provocations can be removed at the discretion of the moderators
- Toxic behavior will not be tolerated
- No advertisements and self-advertisement
- No spam
- No pornography / adult content
- Content that is illegal in Germany, Austria or Switzerland will be deleted and can lead to an immediate ban of the account.    
:::

This text was partly adapted and modified from chaos.social. It is free to be adapted and remixed under the terms of the CC-BY (Attribution 4.0 International) license.

This instance currently allows new community creation, however the following subjects are explicitly not allowed as communities. 

* Nothing positive or promoting cryptocurrency, blockchain or NFTs
* Nothing extreme-right-wing. This includes conspiracy theories, SovCit, Pro-Police, AnCaps etc. We'll know it when we see it, don't test us!
* No anti-science topics.
* No Tankie shit.
* No TERFs.
* No Porn.

Preferably you'll stay within the topics endorsed by this instance (see first line)

Note that you are expected to attempt to create an active community and not just squat on a name. [Inactive communities will be purged](https://lemmy.dbzer0.com/post/56147) after receiving a warning.

**NEW** Now you can also join the [Fediverse Anarchist Flotilla Matrix Space](https://matrix.to/#/#fediverse-anarchist-flotilla:anarchist.nexus) where most of our general inter-instance chat rooms are now located!

When going to other communities, respect their rules AND our rules when they are more restrictive. Do not give cause for others to de-federate our instance please.

site.sidebar:
---

### Welcome üçÅ

---

**Lemmy.ca** is run by Canadians, hosted in Canada, and geared toward Canadians. However, it is not restricted to Canadians, or Canadian culture/topics/etc. All are welcome!

To learn more about what Lemmy is, or how the Fediverse works, you can visit our simple [Getting Started Guide](https://fedecan.ca/en/guide/get-started).

This site is run by the non-profit [Fedecan](https://fedecan.ca/) and funded entirely by user donations. You can help support us by visiting our [donations page](https://fedecan.ca/en/donate).

---

#### Rules and Guidelines

::: spoiler 1. No Bigotry
Including racism, sexism, ableism, homophobia, transphobia, or xenophobia.
:::  
::: spoiler 2. Be Civil
Argue in good faith, attack the argument; not the person, and promote a healthy debate. That includes implying violence, threats or wishes of violence and/or death.
:::  
::: spoiler 3. No Porn
This instance is not made to host porn communities. You're free to access porn communities on other instances through your account, but be mindful of Rule 4.
:::  
::: spoiler 4. Use the NSFW tag
Use your common sense: if you wouldn't want this image to show up on your work computer, tag it as such. In comments, use the `:::spoiler :::` tag for NSFW images, and put a NSFW mention beside links. Do not use NSFW images as your avatar or banner.
:::  
::: spoiler 5. No Ads / Spam
This instance is not there to act as your billboard. If you want to promote your personal work, at least make the effort to be a contributing member of this community. Your account purpose shouldn't be to only advertise, make it natural.
:::  
::: spoiler 6. Bot account
If you are the operator of a "bot" account, make sure to flag is as such in the [account's settings](/settings).
:::  
::: spoiler 7. Right to privacy
Do NOT distribute the personal information of someone else without their consent (aka doxxing). Information that is public domain can be shared, provided it is in good faith.   
*ex: The official email of an elected official is fair, the private phone number or the real name of a non-public person is NOT.*
:::  
::: spoiler 8. Report abuse
The report function isn't labelled the *disagree* button. You might not agree with someone, but that doesn't mean what the person says is against the rules. Using it repeately in this fashion will lead to actions being taken against the reporter.
:::  
::: spoiler 9. Impersonation
Don't make an account with the intent to negatively deceive or defame someone on the fediverse.  
*ex: Parody of a famous person is okay, submitting outrageous content as appearing like another user, mod or admin isn't.*  
:::

---

**Contact an Admin:**

- Send us a message at [@admin@lemmy.ca](https://lemmy.ca/u/admin)
- Send us an email at [support@lemmy.ca](mailto:support@lemmy.ca)

**Guides:**

You can find more guides at [fedecan.ca](https://fedecan.ca/en/guide/get-started) by opening the sidebar.

- [Welcome to the Fediverse](https://fedecan.ca/en/guide/get-started)
- [About Us (Fedecan)](https://fedecan.ca/en/guide/fedecan/)
- [Get Started with Lemmy](https://fedecan.ca/en/guide/lemmy/for-users)

**Meta Communities:**

- [!main](/c/main@lemmy.ca): announcements & general discussion
- [!lemmy_ca_support](/c/lemmy_ca_support@lemmy.ca): support requests
- [!communityrequests](/c/communityrequests@lemmy.ca): become a mod of an existing community

**Other Frontends:** 

Don't like how Lemmy looks? Try one of our [alternative UIs](https://fedecan.ca/en/guide/lemmy/for-users/alternative-uis):

- [old.lemmy.ca](https://old.lemmy.ca/) (Mlmym)

site.name: Bl√•haj Lemmy
site.sidebar:
![Bl√•haj Lemmy](https://pictrs.blahaj.zone/pictrs/image/f6f1a2d3-5eda-415d-82ac-fec39f5d6875.webp "Bl√•haj lemmy")

Bl√•haj Lemmy is brought to you by the kind folk at Bl√•haj Zone, and while anyone is free to register for an account here, please bear in mind that this is a server that is very protective of our minority members and bigotry of any variety will be squashed with great prejudice.

We have several alternative lemmy frontends you can use. Just login with your regular blahaj login details.
* https://tes.lemmy.blahaj.zone/
* https://alx.lemmy.blahaj.zone/
* https://mlmym.lemmy.blahaj.zone/.
* https://phtn.lemmy.blahaj.zone/

We have a public matrix channel for all Blahaj users at [#blahaj:chat.blahaj.zone](https://matrix.to/#/#blahaj:chat.blahaj.zone) 

We also have a matrix channel for gender diverse folk and our allies! If you're already a matrix user, you can head straight to our application room https://matrix.to/#/#gv-apply:chat.blahaj.zone, or by searching for #gv-apply:chat.blahaj.zone from within your matrix client.

If you're new to matrix, you can find some more details and an instruction video on how to get up and running here https://chat.blahaj.zone/c/genderverse/

**Community Guidelines**

Bl√•haj Lemmy is a space where everyone should feel able to participate safely, and to that end, our community is built on the guiding philosophies of empathy, inclusion and acceptance. 

*Empathy*

We want our community members to be guided by compassion and empathy for others. 

Examples of behaviour that are contrary to this philosophy are personal attacks, insults, doxing etc. If your comment is designed to hurt someone, this isn't the space for it.

*Inclusion and Acceptance*

Embracing inclusion and acceptance means listening when people tell you who they are and what their needs are. It means not telling people that you know their experiences better than they do. It means not gatekeeping experiences of identities of others. It means no bigotry such as racism, sexism, anti LGBT commentary, ableism etc. It means doing your best to ensure that you don't over-talk the voices of folk who don't share your privileges.

**Supporting Bl√•haj Lemmy**

After much hesitation, [we have a Ko Fi](https://ko-fi.com/blahajzone) to enable people to help with supporting some of the running costs associated with our instances. 

Providing a safe space for our community is the goal, so please only consider donating if you are in a position to do so without *any* financial stress. 

**Mascot and logo**

Find out about our mascot Shonky (they/them) who appears on our site logo [here](https://github.com/blahaj-zone/shonky).

--

site.name: Feddit UK
site.sidebar:
### Who are we?
Feddit.uk is UK-centric, with integration to the wider Fediverse.   
  We tend to focus on UK-interest communities, others are welcome.

  The name is a shortening of "federate it".  
  Want to share a thing? Share it with the fediverse, or, fed-it.  
- See it
- Like it?
- Feddit

### What are the rules here?
* No racism, sexism, homophobia, transphobia or xenophobia
  * See our [guidelines on transphobia](https://guide.feddit.uk/politics/transphobia.html) for more detail
* No incitement of violence or promotion of violent ideologies
* No harassment, dogpiling or doxxing of other users
* Do not share intentionally false or misleading information
* Do not spam or abuse network features.
* Alt accounts are permitted, but all accounts must list each other in their bios. 
* No generative AI content

Rules apply on this instance, and when using an account from this instance to interact with other instances.  
  Administrators may warn or ban for breaches of the rules, or the spirit of the rules.

### Where should I start?

If you are new, say "hello" over at !welcome@feddit.uk. We can offer any specific help you might need there. Other than that...

#### Here
- !unitedkingdom@feddit.uk for general UK news.
- !casualuk@feddit.uk for general chit-chat.
- !uk_politics@feddit.uk for politics.
- !memes@feddit.uk to watch us get arrested for stealing memes without a licence.
- !askuk@feddit.uk to find out where to get a meme licence.
- !andfinally@feddit.uk for silly news.

#### Elsewhere

[What is Solarpunk?](https://wiki.slrpnk.net/articles:whatissolarpunk)

[A SolarPunk Manifesto](https://wiki.slrpnk.net/articles:manifesto)

**Basic Rules:**
- **be constructive**: there is no need of another internet space full of competition, negativity, rage etc.;
- **no bigotry**, including racism, sexism, ableism, transphobia, homophobia or xenophobia;
- **be empathic**: empathy is more rebellious than a middle finger;
- **no porn and no gore**: let's keep this place easy to manage;
- **no ads / spamming / flooding**, we don't want to buy/consume your commodified ideas;
- **occasional self-promotion** by active members is fine.

[Quick-start guide to Lemmy](https://wiki.slrpnk.net/lemmy)

For any community related question or to just test some function: [!meta@slrpnk.net](https://slrpnk.net/c/meta)

Try our [Photon](https://photon.slrpnk.net/) & [Alexandrite](https://alexandrite.slrpnk.net/) frontends.

Or try our [lightweight UI](https://old.slrpnk.net/) and [Voyager mobile UI](https://voyager.slrpnk.net/).

All accounts also work with [XMPP chat](https://joinjabber.org/) automatically incl. our [Movim](https://movim.slrpnk.net/) client.

If you need to jointly brainstorm on your next Solarpunk text, try our [Etherpad](https://pads.slrpnk.net/).

And don't miss [our Wiki](https://wiki.slrpnk.net/).

[You can also donate towards the running costs of this instance](https://contribute.f-hub.org/?project=1).

site.name: Beehaw
site.sidebar:
---

We're a collective of individuals upset with the way social media has been traditionally governed. A severe lack of moderation has led to major platforms like Facebook to turn into political machinery focused on disinformation campaigns as a way to make profit off of users. Websites with ineffective moderation allow hate speech to proliferate and contribute to the erosion of minority rights and safe spaces. Our goal with Beehaw is to demonstrate and promote a healthier environment.

Our philosophy: 
* [What is Beehaw?](https://docs.beehaw.org/docs/core-principles/what-is-beehaw/)
* [The spirit of the rules](https://docs.beehaw.org/docs/core-principles/the-spirit-of-beehaw/)
* [Beehaw is a Community](https://docs.beehaw.org/docs/core-principles/beehaw-is-a-community/)
and more on our [Docs Website](https://docs.beehaw.org/)

Downvotes are disabled on this instance.

### Be(e) nice.

------

As a news aggregator and a social media outlet, with a focus on being a safe and accepting space, we strive to create a positive social impact. We will, also, help to connect underprivileged and minority individuals with education and civic participation by promoting a healthier online experience.

------

We currently have a Mastodon account you can follow for major updates: [@beehaw](https://hachyderm.io/@beehaw) at hachyderm.io. You can also join our community [Discord](https://discord.gg/ZtZzR6TWs2) or [Matrix](https://matrix.to/#/#beehaw:matrix.org) servers. You can also view our [status page](https://status.beehaw.org/).

-------

Our instance is 100% user-funded - help us keep it running by donating.

If you donate, you should know that 100% of the costs will go towards server time, licensing costs, and artwork. 

In the future if we need to hire developers or other labor, it would be sourced through the [Open Collective Europe Foundation](https://opencollective.com/beehaw-collective), and it would be transparent to the community before any changes were made.

[![Donate on Opencollective](https://opencollective.com/beehaw-collective/donate/button.png?color=blue)](https://opencollective.com/beehaw-collective/donate)

---

Our community icons were made by Aaron Schneider under the [CC-BY-NC-SA-4.0 license](https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc-sa/4.0/).  

Blobbee emojis made by [olivvybee](https://github.com/olivvybee/emojis) on Github. 

Our most up to date [FAQ can be found here](https://docs.beehaw.org/docs/faq/).

---

![if you can see this, it's up](https://status.beehaw.org/api/v1/endpoints/beehaw_beehaw/uptimes/24h/badge.svg)

Her kan du snakke med andre danskere om alt mellem himmel og jord (husk dog at l√¶se reglerne nedenfor).

Feddit.dk er en instans af [Lemmy](https://github.com/LemmyNet/lemmy), som er en fri forumplatform, som ikke kan styres af enkelte firmaer. Derved fungerer Feddit.dk som et frit alternativ til andre lignende sociale platforme (fx Reddit), dog uden reklamer eller topstyring fra et amerikansk selskab.

Feddit.dk er en del af [Fediverset](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fediverse), et forbund af uafh√¶ngige sociale platforme forbundet via internettet. Ved at registrere dig hos Feddit.dk kan du dermed ogs√• tilg√• andre sider i forbundet. Du kan se en oversigt over andre Lemmy-sider [her](https://join-lemmy.org/instances).

---

# Regler
1. Husk mennesket p√• den anden side af sk√¶rmen. V√¶r rar ved andre og vis respekt.
2. Indl√¶g skal prim√¶rt v√¶re p√• dansk. Svensk, norsk, gr√∏nlandsk, f√¶r√∏sk og engelsk er tilladt i et begr√¶nset omfang.
3. Indl√¶g skal v√¶re inden for den danske lovgivnings rammer. Det du skriver, b√∏r du ligeledes kunne sige til en person, du m√∏der p√• gaden.
4. Reklamer eller andre former for selvpromovering og spam er ikke tilladt.

site.name: Mander
site.sidebar:
We follow Lemmy's [code of conduct](https://join-lemmy.org/docs/en/code_of_conduct.html). 

Please be respectful to each other. 

The main focus of this instance is the natural sciences, and the scope encompasses all of the STEM fields. 

Please keep politics to a minimum. When science is the focus, intersection with politics may be tolerated as long as the discussion is constructive and science remains the focus. As a general rule, political content posted directly to the instance's local communities is discouraged and may be removed. You can of course engage in political discussions in non-local communities. 

As a member of the fediverse, you can create your account here and interact with any other federated community!


To find communities all over the Lemmyverse you can use a community browser such as: https://lemmyverse.net/

To fetch a community, simply copy and paste the community's URL into the search box in Mander.

#### Cos'√® Fedd**it**
Fedd**it** √® l'alternativa italiana a Reddit, basata sul software [Lemmy](https://www.lealternative.net/2022/04/06/cose-lemmy/), uno dei progetti pi√π interessanti del [fediverso](https://peertube.uno/w/pvfVP39daxnZcxCJobSPwY?subtitle=it).

#### Informazioni
Questo server di **Lemmy** √® gestito da [Poliverso](https://poliverso.org/) e [Le Alternative](https://www.lealternative.net/).

#### Regole

üáÆüáπ In questo server √® necessario scrivere principalmente utilizzando la lingua italiana.

üõé √à ora possibile aprire una nuova comunit√† in maniera del tutto autonoma. Per farlo baster√† premere in alto nel men√π **Crea Comunit√†** e inserirne i dati necessari. Le comunit√† senza post n√© commenti dopo diversi mesi verranno cancellate previo contatto con il proprio creatore.

üìú Ogni comunit√† sceglier√† in autonomia le sue regole, i suoi moderatori e le sue esigenze. Non sar√† tuttavia possibile aprire comunit√† con contenuti pornografici, illegali o con discriminazioni razziali o di genere.

üöØ Le comunit√† politiche dovranno accettare e sottoscrivere una clausola sull'antifascismo.

‚õîÔ∏è Lo spam, i bot e i messaggi ripetuti o molesti saranno rimossi a prescindere dalle regole della comunit√†.

‚ôªÔ∏è Le comunit√† che non riusciranno ad auto-moderarsi verranno richiamate dagli admin e se non sar√† possibile trovare una soluzione verranno eliminate.

#### Come si mantiene Feddit?

üß° √à un progetto indipendente e senza pubblicit√†, se volete potete aiutare la gestione di questo server con una piccola [donazione ricorrente su LiberaPay](https://liberapay.com/Feddit-it) oppure con una [donazione una tantum su Ko-Fi](https://ko-fi.com/fedditit).

Il server utilizzato √® quello di [Hetzner](https://hetzner.cloud/?ref=ms8NgG4wXs5W), in Finlandia. Se volete provarlo potete ottenere 20‚Ç¨ gratuiti con [questo link](https://hetzner.cloud/?ref=ms8NgG4wXs5W) e noi riceveremo un aiuto sotto forma di credito da usare proprio per mantenere Feddit.

Grazie! üß°

üìß Per informazioni sull'istanza potete scrivere a lemmy@feddit.it

site.name: Leminal Space
site.sidebar:
### What is Lemmy?
Leminal Space is an instance of the social link aggregation and discussion platform [Lemmy](https://join-lemmy.org/). It is completely free and open, and not controlled by any company. This means that there is no advertising, tracking, or secret algorithms. Content is organised into communities, so it is easy to subscribe to topics that you are interested in, and ignore others. Voting is used to bring the most interesting items to the top.

*If you can't find the community you'd like to join in the [All Communities](https://leminal.space/communities?listingType=All&amp%3Bpage=0) section, try searching for it on the Lemmy Explorer [communities page](https://lemmyverse.net/communities), then copy and paste the community link in the [Search](https://leminal.space/search?type=Communities&amp%3BlistingType=All&amp%3Bpage=1&amp%3Bsort=TopAll) box.*

**Featured Communities:**
- [!technology@lemmy.world](https://leminal.space/c/technology@lemmy.world)
- [!games@sh.itjust.works](https://leminal.space/c/games@sh.itjust.works)
- [!asklemmy@lemmy.ml](https://leminal.space/c/asklemmy@lemmy.ml)
- [!aww@lemmy.world](https://leminal.space/c/aww@lemmy.world)
- [!worldnews@lemmy.ml](https://leminal.space/c/worldnews@lemmy.ml)
- [!cat@lemmy.world](https://leminal.space/c/cat@lemmy.world)

**Meta Communities:**
- [Leminal Space](https://leminal.space/c/leminalspace) (announcements)
- [Leminal Space Meta](https://leminal.space/c/leminalspacemeta) (discussion)

---
### Code of Conduct
1. Bigotry will not be tolerated. This includes racism, sexism, ableism, homophobia or transphobia. Please also familiarise yourself with the Lemmy [Code of Conduct](https://join-lemmy.org/docs/code_of_conduct.html).
2. While this is tacitly covered by rule #1, for the sake of clarity: fascist or alt-right discourse is not welcome here.
3. Be respectful.
4. No pornography.
5. No advertising or spam.

---
#### Donations
If you would like to contribute towards our running costs, you can donate through the below platforms.

**Welcome to discuss.online!**

Home for interesting conversation, discovery, and fun. Everyone is welcome!

# Guidelines

discuss.online aims to enrich the lives of everyone it touches. Please be kind as you use it.

Read the [posting guidelines](https://wiki.discuss.online/view/Guidelines), but remember that the guidelines are fuzzy and imprecise, because the admins have final say.

Some NSFW content is fine if tagged appropriately, but no porn or hornyposting.

site.sidebar:
**Welcome to Europe Pub!** üá™üá∫

A social network dedicated to everything European. From culture and traditions to current events and daily life across our diverse continent. Share your experiences, discuss news, and connect with fellow Europeans and friends of Europe.

Whether you're interested in EU politics, travel tips, local cuisine, or simply want to learn more about different European countries and regions, you'll find your place here.

You can participate in more than 29,000 communities around the world, thanks to the Fediverse.

Join our community and help build bridges across Europe! üåâ

Choose your experience:

- [Europe Pub Photon (photon.europe.pub)](https://photon.europe.pub/) ‚Äì the easy and clean one
- [Europe Pub Voyager (voyager.europe.pub)](https://voyager.europe.pub/posts/europe.pub/all) ‚Äì the advanced and customizable one
- [Europe Pub Blorp (blorp.europe.pub)](https://blorp.europe.pub/) ‚Äì the intuitive one
- [Default Lemmy UI](https://europe.pub/) ‚Äì not the prettiest but many love it
- [OG Reddit Like UI (old.europe.pub)](https://old.europe.pub/) ‚Äì if you prefer retro reddit flairs

You can install them directly from within your browser. No app download needed.

[![Support us on tipeee](https://europe.pub/pictrs/image/7b05dc2a-b07f-4c58-912a-3021ff5010c9.png?thumbnail=150)](https://tipeee.com/tfmat/)

site.name: The Lemmy Club
site.sidebar:
Welcome to The Lemmy Club!

Instance Rules:

1. Don't be a dick.    
2. Do NOT make me add new rules.
3. Racism/slurs/etc use will not be tolerated.    
4. No spamming.    
5. Don't harass other users (See rule 1)    
6. NSFW content must be marked correctly.    
7. All content must comply with US law     
8. Loli/etc. will not be tolerated. Suggestive or sexual art must be reasonably recognizable as *adult* subjects.    
9. Users or communities that, in the view of the admin team, jeopardize the good standing of The Lemmy Club with other instances may be removed.
10. These rules apply to all content and users that appear on The Lemmy Club. Moderation is on an as noticed/as reported basis. If you see rule breaking content, I likely have just not seen it yet. Please report it.    
11. Instances/users/communities that tolerate, repeatedly fail to enforce, or allow content that breaks any of these rules may be banned from The Lemmy Club.    
12. The site admin team (well, just @bdonvr really as of now) has final say in interpretations of all rules.   

Help contribute towards our operating costs to keep us going and growing:  https://opencollective.com/thelemmyclub/

We host [MLMYM](https://github.com/rystaf/mlmym) (a clone of old.reddit) at https://old.thelemmy.club/

We host [Voyager](https://github.com/aeharding/voyager) (a mobile optimized webapp) at https://app.thelemmy.club/

site.name: literature.cafe
site.sidebar:
###### (and anyone else, really)

This is a general special interest lemmy instance focusing on lovers of all things pertaining to reading and writing and all of the people that enjoy it as well as fandoms and niches that exist within reading circles. We federate with other instances, with our local communities being focused primarily on the above.

> If you want to federate a new community, go to lemmyverse.net and copy a link to a community and paste it into the search bar. Be patient!

>Also, consider installing instance assistant to better navigate lemmy and find communities better! Find links to download them here: [firefox](https://addons.mozilla.org/en-CA/firefox/addon/lemmy-instance-assistant/), [chrome](https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/instance-assistant-for-le/mbblbalkjcikhpladidpimlfiapdffdh), [edge](https://microsoftedge.microsoft.com/addons/detail/instance-assistant-for-le/hnlndgeokcaocdklkbfjbfjplfnedehb)

---
##### Instance Rules
1. Keep it cozy. (No -isms, bigotry, gatekeeping, or general disrespect. Just be nice!)
2. Please, no visual porn. *(Smut and discussion of smut is OK as long as it is tagged as NSFW.)*
3. No spam.
4. Be mindful of other instance rules.
5. Keep self-promo to a minimum.
6. Tag AI generated content as such.
7. Please avoid piracy.
8. Please keep instance-hosted communities related to literature and literature-adjacent topics.

---

##### Server Info
Registration is open with human approval, just to make sure there's no bots afoot. Approval should take less than a day (and are sometimes near instant)

Please check your spam folder for an email from **noreply@literature.cafe** if you are having difficulty finding email confirmation.

Community creation is enabled. When creating new communities please be mindful of the instance focus.

If you have any issues or concerns, please message an admin

 [![Fediseer Guarantees](https://fediseer.com/api/v1/badges/endorsements/literature.cafe.svg)](https://fediseer.com/api/v1/whitelist/literature.cafe) 

---

For those visiting from other instances, we have a community directory to make finding communities easier: !411@literature.cafe

---

We also have alternative lemmy UIs to use for those who want them.

A familiar UI - [old.literature.cafe](https://old.literature.cafe/)

Photon - [ph.literature.cafe](https://ph.literature.cafe/)

Tesseract (photon fork with more multimedia focused features) - [t.literature.cafe](https://t.literature.cafe/)

---

Donations are greatly appreciated and go entirely to server costs but are not required.

[![List of Patrons](https://img.shields.io/liberapay/patrons/literature.cafe.svg?logo=liberapay)](https://liberapay.com/literature.cafe/)

site.name: Lemmy Myserv one
site.sidebar:
Lemmy users are encouraged to use this instance to browse the fediverse. Its designed to help keep other Lemmy instances fast and working. If they go down you can still access other Lemmy communities. As this Lemmy instance is designed for users, not communities none are hosted here, it‚Äôs unlikely to be defederated and generally stays connected to a wide range of other Lemmy servers.

You can create an account here to explore and interact with communities across the fediverse while helping reduce traffic on busier instances. It also makes a great backup account if your main instance goes offline.

Server is reliable and easily run and maintained by keeping everything as simple/cheap as possible wherever I can. Downtime is expected to be minimal due to the design, however there are no bells or whistles. This is a cheap to run instance, and I wont let costs run away.

Blocked instances are any instances that host illegal content I am notified about or spam/troll etc. and is pulled from FediNuke.txt that many instances use to block hostile servers. Nothing more, just don't want a hard time. Don't get onto that list. I don't maintain it, I just use it.
Rules are don't be an idiot and make our lives hard basically or troll/be racist/do illegal stuff. I just want things to be simple. 

If any content is found that is questionable or illegal or any of the usual stuff just report it and it can be deleted. If any admin from another instance needs me to ban any user or bot account just contact me. Happy to remove fake or evil accounts. I like to keep things simple as I said. No drama = everyone is happy. If you act like an idiot = ban. If you make me not like you = ban. 

We engage in active moderation against harassment, bullying, racism, discrimination, transphobia, hate speech, violation of privacy threats of violence and illegal activity. If this sounds unfair, please do not join this server.

Any problems just create a support thread or message user ‚ÄòThief‚Äô for help. 
If you cant create a thread email me at: admin at myserv dot one

Terms of use note/TOS : As we cant risk being defederated from lemmy.world our TOS is the same as lemmy.world as found here: https://legal.lemmy.world/tos/
site.description: Users are encouraged to join this Lemmy Server. This Lemmy server was setup to help reduce load on other Lemmy servers.

3. **Usa linguagem percet√≠vel por todos e uma gram√°tica correta.**

6. **√â inaceit√°vel tentar passar por uma outra pessoa.**

> ‚ÑπÔ∏è *Estas regras ser√£o expandidas e um documento de c√≥digo de conduta redigido, na comunidade [Regras](/c/regras), quando o Lemmy suportar melhores controlos de modera√ß√£o para comunidades.*

#### Registo de contas e cria√ß√£o de comunidades

Devido ao aparecimento de [*trolls*](https://pt.wikipedia.org/wiki/Trol_(internet)) e de contas autom√°ticas que poluem a rede com conte√∫do indesejado, o registo de novas contas foi restringido, sendo agora necess√°rio n√£o s√≥ um endere√ßo de correio eletr√≥nico, como o preenchimento de uma pequena "candidatura" que ter√° que ser aprovada por um administrador antes da conta ser ativada.

Pelo mesmo motivo, a cria√ß√£o de comunidades est√° sujeita a uma restri√ß√£o semelhante. 
Ser√° necess√°rio fazer uma publica√ß√£o na comunidade [Meta](/c/meta), com t√≠tulo e corpo adequados, para requisitar a cria√ß√£o de uma nova comunidade.  

Por fim, √© igualmente poss√≠vel requisitar a posi√ß√£o de moderador numa das comunidades originais ou numa que n√£o possua nenhum moderador ativo.
Em qualquer dos casos, haver√° um processo de avalia√ß√£o antes da promo√ß√£o, por motivos de seguran√ßa.

---  

#### [WebTejo](https://webtejo.pt/)

#### Ajudar a correr esta inst√¢ncia

Ningu√©m se deve sentir no dever de doar o que seja, por√©m √†queles e √†quelas que t√™m a **possibilidade** e a vontade, qualquer ajuda √© muito bem-vinda :)

Eis a p√°gina de LiberaPay onde √© poss√≠vel fazer um donativo: https://liberapay.com/lemmy.pt/  
*Num futuro pr√≥ximo vai ser estabelecido um reposit√≥rio com registos mensais de donativos e despesas, de modo a existir maior transpar√™ncia no financiamento da inst√¢ncia. Fiquem atentos.*

---

#### Matrix

Aqui, al√©m de discuss√µes sobre a inst√¢ncia, os administradores v√£o publicando avisos relativamente a problemas t√©cnicos e interrup√ß√µes de servi√ßo.

#### Traduzir o Lemmy

Este processo √© realizado atrav√©s da inst√¢ncia de Weblate (uma ferramenta de tradu√ß√£o, tamb√©m ela livre) do projecto Lemmy, e que pode ser econtrada em https://weblate.join-lemmy.org/

site.name: diggita lemmy social
site.sidebar:
## üîó Benvenuti su [**diggita lemmy social**](https://diggita.com/)

**Un progetto italiano noprofit di editoria sociale partecipativa, federata grazie a lemmy e parte dell'associazione Fedimedia Italia APS**

**Diggita** √® una piattaforma di **giornalismo partecipativo** e **social bookmarking** gestita collettivamente dagli utenti iscritti.
Tutti i contenuti sono **generati, votati e discussi democraticamente** direttamente dalla community.
Creato nel 2007 e ispirato a progetti come Digg e Reddit, Diggita √® uno spazio noprofit che fa parte dell'associazione di promozione sociale [Fedimedia Italia](https://fedimedia.it/) dove aggregare e condividere **notizie, video, articoli, blog post e contenuti indipendenti**.

---

### üß© Diggita √® parte del Fediverso

Nel 2024 il vecchio Diggita.it √® stato abbandonato e ricostruito da zero da volontari dell'associazione noprofit [fedimedia.it](https://fedimeia.it/) che hanno riutilizzato solo il nome e il logo sul nuovo dominio diggita.com con **Lemmy** come software del fediverso a gestire il tutto, lemmy √® l‚Äôalternativa open source e decentralizzata di Reddit.
Questo significa che √® ora parte del **Fediverso**, una rete federata di oltre **30.000 istanze interconnesse** con pi√π di **10 milioni di utenti attivi**.
Chiunque, anche da altre piattaforme come **[Mastodon](https://mastodon.it/)**, pu√≤ seguire, commentare e interagire con quanto pubblicato su Diggita, senza dover creare un nuovo account.

üëâ Compatibile con tutte le app Lemmy per smartphone: [come funziona](https://diggita.com/post/1)

---

### üó£Ô∏è Una comunit√† coesa, come ai tempi dei forum

L‚Äôobiettivo di Diggita √® **ricreare l‚Äôatmosfera dei forum storici**: una comunit√† compatta, collaborativa, senza algoritmi e senza gerarchie editoriali.
Diversamente dalle grandi istanze Lemmy generaliste, qui si pubblica esclusivamente **all‚Äôinterno del sito**, in **poche sezioni tematiche**, per favorire dialoghi pi√π approfonditi e relazioni pi√π autentiche.

---

### üì∞ Notizie indipendenti, segnalazioni libere, fonti diverse

Diggita √® perfetto per:

* chi ha bisogno di **segnalare notizie in modo libero**,
* chi vuole **dare visibilit√† a contenuti indipendenti**,
* chi cerca **fonti alternative** ai media tradizionali.

Le segnalazioni provengono ogni giorno da **centinaia di blog, siti indipendenti e piattaforme del Fediverso** e sono votate dalla community.
**Anche chi √® iscritto solo a Mastodon o ad altre piattaforme federate pu√≤ votare, commentare e partecipare.**

### üì£ Segui diggita anche su:
* üîó **[mastodon](https://mastodon.uno/@diggita)**
* üí¨ **[telegram](https://t.me/diggita)**

---

### ü§ù Un progetto no-profit, sostenuto solo dalle persone

Diggita √® parte delle attivit√† di **[devol.it](https://devol.it/)**, un collettivo che promuove strumenti etici e liberi.
**Non abbiamo pubblicit√†, non abbiamo investitori, non rincorriamo gli algoritmi.**
Ci sosteniamo solo grazie alle **donazioni volontarie**.

‚òï Offrici un caff√® su [Ko-fi](https://ko-fi.com/devol)
[![](https://storage.ko-fi.com/cdn/kofi6.png?v=6)](https://ko-fi.com/devol)

üíõ Oppure sostienici su [Liberapay](https://liberapay.com/devol) [![](https://liberapay.com/assets/widgets/donate.svg)](https://liberapay.com/devol)

### üõ† Altri progetti del gruppo Devol

Oltre a Diggita, il gruppo Devol gestisce altri servizi liberi e federati, accessibili su [servizi.devol.it](https://servizi.devol.it/), tra cui:

* üêò [mastodon.uno](https://mastodon.uno/) ‚Äì microblogging alternativo a Twitter/X
* üì∏ [pixelfed.uno](https://pixelfed.uno/) ‚Äì condivisione foto in stile Instagram, ma etica
* üì∫ [peertube.uno](https://peertube.uno/) ‚Äì video hosting federato, senza pubblicit√†

üì¨ Per restare aggiornati, iscrivetevi alla [newsletter dei Devol](https://newsletter.devol.it/)


### üìö **Diggita.com ‚Äì Libert√† di Condivisione**

Tutti i contenuti presenti su Diggita.com sono pubblicati con licenza **[Creative Commons Attribuzione (CC‚ÄØBY 4.0)](https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/deed.it)**‚ÄØ

![](https://mirrors.creativecommons.org/presskit/buttons/88x31/png/by.png)

Diggita.com crede nella **libera circolazione del sapere**, senza barriere. Scegliamo la licenza pi√π **aperta e permissiva** per garantire che ogni contenuto possa viaggiare, essere studiato, condiviso, remixato, arricchito, dando sempre la paternit√† agli autori originali.

site.name: lazysoci.al
site.sidebar:
# About lazysoci.al
This is my personal instance for accessing the fediverse, however anyone is welcome to join me.

# Meta discussion
Join the community at !meta@lazysoci.al to discuss lazysoci.al topics, or request support.

# Alternative frontends
- [Photon](https://p.lazysoci.al/)
- [Voyager](https://v.lazysoci.al/)
- [Alexandrite](https://a.lazysoci.al/)
- [Tesseract](https://t.lazysoci.al/)
- [Blorp](https://b.lazysoci.al/)

# Rules
**Don't be an asshole**. Seriously, if you are in a heated argument and you feel like its personal, take a break.

**No spamming/trolling**. We are here to interact and have fun. If you think trolling is fun, don't join here.

**No advertising**. Accounts whose sole use is to advertise products or services will be banned.

**Be civil**. You are not only representing yourself, but also this instance. Please be nice.

**Keep it legal**. Don't use this instance to host illegal activities.

The admin receives all reports to your account, even from other instances/communities. Multiple genuine reports may trigger an evaluation of your account being banned.

Due to a recent influx of spam accounts, registrations now require new users to tell me why they want to join this instance. The application will be used to manually spot repeated spammers. Users with throw-away email accounts will be denied.

# Instance hosting
Hosted on non-rented Enterprise hardware at a datacentre near me.

I strive to keep the system online 100%, however it is a hobby project so bear with me if there are problems.

Snapshots are taken every 20 minutes and kept for 3 days. Immutable backups are performed nightly and kept for 12 months. Backups are replicated off-site to my home.

Major upgrades will be performed some weeks after they are made available, unless urgent (ie. security issue). This allows major bug reports to be actioned upon.

A status page is available at https://status.lazysoci.al/

# About me
I work in the UK as an IT consultant with customers in the UK, EEA and the middle east.

My hobbies are Linux infrastructure, raising chickens, PC gaming and of course my great family  ü•∞

**MTGZone** is a **federated** alternative to Reddit, running the amazing Lemmy software, focused on Magic: the Gathering communities and interest areas.

**Communities**

Check out our [Communities page](https://mtgzone.com/communities) and follow any that might interest you! Here are a few to get started:

* [/c/mtg](https://mtgzone.com/c/mtg): the default Magic community here for general discussion

**Contact**

* Chat with us on Matrix at **[#mtgzone-space:matrix.org](https://app.element.io/#/room/#mtgzone-space:matrix.org)**. Our general room is #mtgzone:matrix.org.

**Rules**

Please take a look at our [site rules and community guidelines](https://mtgzone.com/legal) before you get started! We all love Magic here, please be kind to each other!

**Features**

* **Card bot:** mention cards in your posts or comments as [[Card Name]] and [@cardbot ](https://mtgzone.com/@cardbot) will reply with the card image and links.

site.name: KDE Social
site.sidebar:
A worldwide technology community üåç Creators of the Plasma desktop & a variety of Free and open source applications that let you control your digital life.

---
**RULES** 

1. No Spam, and please link to the source instead of blogs that link to the source.  Blogs are fine as long as they have original content or add significant content to news or issue. 
2. This is a community Lemmy instance so be respectful of other users.
3. No trolling and no shitposting. Low quality posts and comments will be removed without warning. Repeat offenders will be banned.
4. Prefer reporting bugs to https://bugs.kde.org/, as KDE developers do not scan lemmy for bug reports.
5. Avoid comparing and/or disparaging various desktop environments, distros, and/or other FLOSS projects. This instance is for discussing the KDE community and the software it produces, and not about pointless flamewars between open source projects.
6. No linking to Twitter/X. Links to Twitter/X from posts or comments will be removed and repeat offenders will be banned.
7. In case of doubt, consult KDE's [Code of conduct](https://kde.org/code-of-conduct/). Violations of the CoC will result in banning.
---

**KDE** is a commmunity creating free and open source software for desktop and portable computing.  

---

**KDE Websites**

* [KDE Homepage](https://kde.org/)
* [KDE Planet](https://planet.kde.org/)
* [KDE Blogs](https://blogs.kde.org/)
* [KDE Discuss (Forum/Discourse)](https://discuss.kde.org/)
* [KDE Wikis](https://wiki.kde.org/)
* [KDE Bug tracker and reporter](https://bugs.kde.org/)

---

**Donate to KDE**

* [Become an official Supporting Member](https://kde.org/fundraisers/plasma6member/)

* [Help fund KDE projects with a one-off donation](https://kde.org/fundraisers/yearend2022/)

---

**Want to contribute to KDE?**

For starters:

* The best way to start contributing is to contact the community over [Matrix](https://community.kde.org/Matrix) and [IRC](https://userbase.kde.org/IRC_Channels)

* At first sight, it might seem a bit hard to interact in those groups. That's okay! Join them first, see how things are done, mention your interest and where you'd like to work with. We may even find a [mentor](https://community.kde.org/Mentoring) for you!

* The KDE Community develops and distributes open source software. As such, we follow a sort of do-ocracy wherein tasks are done and assigned by contributors themselves. Feel free to pick an area and just start contributing immediately! We're always here to help you along the way. A good way to contribute with code for the first time is to fix an unfixed bug that afflicts you or [assign yourself to junior jobs](https://community.kde.org/KDE/Junior_Jobs) and start working on them.

* It's always nice to collaborate optimally with others in any given setting, but this is especially important for community projects like those following the open source model, so remember to read the [KDE Code of Conduct](https://kde.org/code-of-conduct/).

Here are a few links to help you in your first contributions to KDE:

* [Get Involved](https://community.kde.org/Get_Involved)

* [Your first commit](https://community.kde.org/Infrastructure/GitLab)

* [Write code](https://community.kde.org/Get_Involved/development)

* [Report issues](https://community.kde.org/Get_Involved/Issue_Reporting)

* [Triage bug reports](https://community.kde.org/Guidelines_and_HOWTOs/Bug_triaging)

* [Translate software and documentation](https://community.kde.org/Get_Involved/translation)

* [Design applications and icons](https://community.kde.org/Get_Involved/design)

* [Write documentation](https://community.kde.org/Get_Involved/documentation)

* [Manage websites and backends](https://community.kde.org/KDE.org)

* [Support other users](https://community.kde.org/Get_Involved/support)

* [Promote KDE](https://community.kde.org/Get_Involved/promotion)

* [Make KDE software more accessible](https://community.kde.org/Get_Involved/accessibility)

* [Assist with management and organization](https://community.kde.org/Gardening)

* [Update the wikis](https://userbase.kde.org/Tasks_and_Tools)

---

Get started learning QML:

* [The new KDE intro to QML](https://develop.kde.org/docs/plasma/widget/qml/)

* [The original Plasma Developer Guide](https://community.kde.org/Plasma/DeveloperGuide)

* [Test QML code live](https://qmlonline.kde.org/)

* [Comprehensive community book on QML](https://qmlbook.github.io/)

* [The official KDAB YouTube course on QML](https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL6CJYn40gN6hdNC1IGQZfVI707dh9DPRc)

* [The official Qt documentation on QML](https://doc.qt.io/qt-5/qml-tutorial.html)

---

Get started learning C++:

* [The new KDE intro to C++](https://develop.kde.org/docs/getting-started/hello_world/)

* [An app to more easily create apps with a template, KAppTemplate](https://userbase.kde.org/KAppTemplate)

* [The free edX course by New York University](https://www.edx.org/course/introduction-to-programming-in-c)

* [The freemium Codecademy course](https://www.codecademy.com/learn/learn-c-plus-plus)

* [Comprehensive wikibook for C++](https://en.wikibooks.org/wiki/C%2B%2B_Programming)

* [The Wikiversity C++ course](https://en.wikiversity.org/wiki/C%2B%2B)

* [The LearnCPP tutorial website](https://www.learncpp.com/)

* [The CPlusPlus tutorial website](http://www.cplusplus.com/doc/tutorial/)

---
